directions: In a 1 1/2-quart saucepan cook bacon over moderate heat until crisp and transfer with a slotted spoon to paper towels to drain. In fat remaining in pan cook onion, celery, and garlic with salt and pepper to taste over moderately low heat, stirring, until softened.

In a bowl whisk together reserved clam liquor, wine, water, and tomato paste and add to onion mixture. Peel potato and cut into 1/2-inch pieces. Add potato and tomatoes to saucepan and simmer, covered, until potato is tender, about 15 minutes. Add clams and parsley and simmer, covered, 2 minutes.
ingredients: 1 1/2 dozen small hard-shelled clams, shucked, reserving 1/2 cup liquor, and chopped
2 medium vine-ripened tomatoes, seeded and chopped
2 tablespoons finely chopped fresh parsley leaves
title: Tomato and Bacon Clam Chowder
